column1: Name of file that was updated:
Description of methods used for collection/generation of data:
column2: All intact, mature sporophytes with a holdfast, stipe, bulb and blades were measured on the beach.  The length of stipe was measured to the nearest cm.  The circumference of the bulb was measured to the nearest 0.1 cm, and the diameter was determined using the OmniCircumference Calculator on the Web.  The widest sterile or fertile blade was measured to  the nearest 0.1 cm.  The number of intact sori, releasing sori and abscised sori on the widest fertile blade was recorded.  The algal epiphytes, barnacles and hydroids on the stipe were recorded.  For wet weight biomass, the stipe was excised at 15 cm below the blade attachment. The blade was washed in ocean or creek water, drained and placed in a slingand weighed using a Modern Step Hanging Scale.

column2: The day that the transect was surveyed.
Length of stipe to 15 cm below the attachment of the blades to the nearest cm.
The length of the diameter of the bulb as transformed from the bulb circumference to the nearest 0.1 cm.
The width of the widest blade of the sporophyte to the nearest 0.1 cm.
The number of intact sori on the widest blade of the sporophyte.
The number of sori releasing propagules on the the widest fertile blade.
The number of sori that had abscised from the widest fertile blade.
The algal epiphytes, barnacles and hydroids found on the stipe.
In the stipe column, none means that no kelp were found on the beach.
In the epiphyte columns, none means that there were no epiphytes observed.
NA means that no measurements were taken because no kelp was present.
nd means that although data existed, it was not measured, or the tip of blade was missing and number of abscised sori could not be determined.
